}} 'Period' ('per') is a gene located on the X chromosome of [[Drosophila
melanogaster]]. Oscillations in levels of both per transcript and its
corresponding protein PER have a period of approximately 24 hours and together
play a central role in the molecular mechanism of the Drosophila biological
clock driving circadian rhythms in eclosion and locomotor activity. Mutations in the per gene can
shorten (per S), lengthen (per L), and even abolish
(per 0) the period of the circadian rhythm.
